phrases: With Diamond Service, you get diamond-level security.
All bugs and performance issues will be fixed right away.
And with our newest service, we can link our control panel to your restaurant kitchen's system!
If you are an industry professional, we look forward to hearing from you.
Himouto Umaru-chan R has been brought to you by this sponsor!
You have not packed a whole lot if you will be gone for two weeks...
Anyway, I am worried about leaving you alone for so long.
I told you, I will be fine.
Kirie will come by and stuff.
Is it okay if I order some pizza?
I want to have a party, Big Brother!
I made some food and put it in the freezer, but I guess she would get bored eating just that, huh?
I want to have a party, Big Brother!
I made some food and put it in the freezer, but I guess she would get bored eating just that, huh?
You are so kind, Big Brother!
A business trip on our day off... sure is a pain, huh?
I will be gone for two weeks, so...
Dude, 10,000 yen is not enough for two weeks, right?
I could burn through that in a day!
Still, it could be fun if we think of it as a vacation, right?
Hamamatsu is famous for eel, right?
Big Brother, what is this about eel?!
Taihei's project is to come up with a restaurant's management system.
The restaurant's an affiliate of our company, so we are going to Hamamatsu to gather more information.
I will just buy some eel on the way back...
No fair, no fair, no fair!
I want to eat eel too!
That is a tantrum that sure makes use of limited space!
It is not fair if only YOU get to eat it!
I want to see those eels too!
I thought this might happen, which is why I did not say anything...
I want to see those eels too!
How about we bring Tanukichi with us?
I want to see those eels too!
So sleepy... it is WAY too early!
I am used to getting up early for anime events.
More importunately, why is Kanau here?
She is got nothing to do with this, does she?
She is the one who planned this whole trip, right?
It is the ocean, the ocean!
She sure did want to come.
Maybe I will bring her here sometime.
I still do not know if she will be okay on her own.
She is probably eating right about now...
Wait, can she even get up on her own?
Big Brother, how long till we get to Hamamatsu?
Umaru has joined your business trip, Big Brother!
C'mon, let me tag along for a bit.
This is not a game, you know!
I will not go back until I have tasted eel!
You are being way too loud!
We will be gone two whole weeks, so I am sure I will get my chance!
You are being way too loud!
We will be gone two whole weeks, so I am sure I will get my chance!
We will be gone two whole weeks, so I am sure I will get my chance!
I feel like... something is going to happen!
Located in western Shizuoka, it is the largest city in the prefecture.
The area around Lake Hamana to the south is a resort area famous throughout Japan.
It is easily accessible, and the scenery is remarkable!
it is famous for its eel!
What am I going to do with her?
It is not like I can introduce her to Kanau...
Just wait till it is time to review your bonus...
W-well, it is about when we are supposed to be there...
I guess I confused 8:00 AM with 8:00 PM.
I mean, if they say 8:00, you would assume 8 AM, right?
At least we will not have to worry about being late, right?
She is always been the type to make some huge-ass mistake...
Well, how about we fill the time by researching the local restaurants?
Sh-should we really break up the group to do things on our own?
There is a lot I would like to check out, for future's sake.
I would like to check out some venues where we can have our ceremony, for future's sake.
Let us check out Hamamatsu's anime shops!
Jeez, you kept me waiting way too-
I cannot believe you came all this way.
But after lunch, you need to leave.
No, it is still a bit too early.
How about... we do some sightseeing?
Note: An anime pilgrimage means to visit real-life locations that have appeared in favorite manga or anime.
I want to do an anime pilgrimage!
They have used a lot of places here in Hamamatsu!
Just make sure you do not bother the locals.
And we will be doing NORMAL sightseeing as well.
Oh... the Arch of Lucky Stars!
This says that if two people touch it at the same time, something good will happen.
Wait, would not it usually be COUPLES who do this?
It does not say anywhere that siblings cannot do it!
And speaking of couples, Big Brother...
Just who is... that girl who came with you?
But you call her by her first name!
You sure have been paying attention...
Note: in Japan, only people who are VERY close will call each other by their first name.
Even married couples often do not - they just say you.
Your boss, and yet you use her FIRST name?
How did this come to be?
Why are you talking like that?
For better or worse, we have been pretty much inseparable, and have spent a LOT of time together.
Wait, she is the same age as you, but she is your boss?
She is actually a year younger.
I am not sure I should be saying this, but...
I am sure she feels a lot of pressure being section chief at her age...
She makes mistakes, but I think she is doing her best.
Wait, you came because THAT IS what you were worried about?
I-I came because I wanted to eat some eel!
It is still a little early, but maybe we should get going.
Sure enough, there are not many people here this early...
Is researching that part of your job too?
Here is your order, one charbroiled eel!
This is not farm-raised eel from Lake Hamana, it is wild-caught, the real deal!
Eel in broth is nice too.
Look, just add soup broth and seasonings, and it will really change the flavor.
A rather clean flavor profile, I would say...
The flavor of the wasabi as it passes through the nostrils is exquisite!
I was thinking, I am glad we came.
Be careful on the way home.
And you, have a safe trip!
Do your best on the job, okay?
It is not even 6:00 yet, so we are a bit early, but it will be fine, right?
My, what cute youngsters you are!
Well, you can start by prepping these potatoes.
Um, we are with Diamond Service, regarding data on your customer-
Here, you will address me as Chef.
And in the kitchen, the chef's word is absolute.
You will do this for me.
Taihei... that outfit looks great on you!
You have one hour to prep 300 of these!
Wait, you came because THAT IS what you were worried about?
So sleepy... maybe I should not follow him after all.
If something is bothering you, just ask for advice.
Still, to think there would be a restaurant HERE of all places...
You, me, and Umaru should come here some time.
Food always tastes better with friends.
something I would like to talk to you about.
am looking for a particular restaurant.
It is already been a week since we have come to Hamamatsu.
I will take Kanau her plate.
Wait, has Alex always called her Kanau, by her first name?
I was not sure what would happen, being made to work in the kitchen...
but being here has made it easier to write my report and put together a system plan.
The chef and the other staff have really opened up as well...
You have work to get back to in Tokyo, do not you?
Yeah, but doing that means going back to the grind, so...
Corporate life is hard, is not it?
Or, rather, talking to one another has helped us all get along.
They just keep giving us more stuff to do!
Our CEO likes to diversify the business, but it is all totally random!
This very restaurant started up in Tokyo, but the CEO got a wild hair and, goodness!
Um, I think that is enough talk about that...
You know your way around a kitchen, do not you?
I bet she is finicky, is not she?
I can tell from the way you prep.
The way you peel the potatoes, polish the rice...
They feel like they are from cooking not for yourself, but for someone else.
They feel like they are from cooking not for yourself, but for someone else.
They feel like they are from cooking not for yourself, but for someone else.
It is not like you to speak so kindly.
Say, why not be a lamb and work here with us?
You take cooking as seriously as any pro.
I have to get back so I can do my cooking at home.
Did I do something wrong in the game, Master?
No, it just felt like someone was gossiping about me...
Still, I am glad to have been able to learn from you, Chef.
Everything you have made has been delicious.
Ko-chan, you have got smoke coming from your ears...
Come to think of it, we have not even heard his name...
The same surname as our little miss Ebina, huh?
Still, they do not look or act the same at all.
You are looking for a restaurant?
I have heard he is working at a restaurant in Tokyo.
He left home 10 years ago... still, I am sure he is doing well.
Do not go slacking off during the afternoon service!
A lot has happened these past two weeks.
Two weeks, and nothing happened at all!
It is already been two weeks!
I TOLD YOU NOT TO MAKE A MESS!
It is like you have perfected the way you get angry!
Sure enough, it is totally bare...
You brought back a lot of souvenirs, Big Brother.
I am going to be giving some as gifts.
I will do it while I am out shopping.
Be sure to eat them before they expire.
Chef and I exchanged phone numbers... maybe I should get in touch with him soon.
Say, have you heard anything about Ebina's family?
But I have never been to Kirie's house, so I do not know where it is.
Note: Shikuwasa is a form of citrus native to Okinawa.
Well, how about we just give it to her next time she comes over?
How many times do I have to tell you?!
You seem like you are in a good mood, Sylphin.
Indeed, for my big brother has come home!
Oh, it is that girl from before.
Thank you for being such a good friend to my sister.
This is a small gift from Hamamatsu.
I feel like I have just seen this...
She is a bit strange, but she is nice.
I am going to go get some cola and potato chips!
Not for yourself, but for someone else.
It is been two weeks, huh?
And there is the super rare item!
I did not play these much while you were gone, you know!
So she was still able to have fun on her own.
I guess there was no need for me to worry.
Umaru, it is been a while since we have done the preview together, has not it?
I am so glad to get here and FINALLY find one of the regular female cast members!
It seems you have had it rough.
Anyway, and now for the preview!
Wait, we are out of time!
